name: ArtifactoryGenericUpload
description: Upload build artifacts to Artifactory using FileSpecs while allowing to collect build-info. The collected build-info can be later published to Artifactory by the "Artifactory Publish Build Info" task.
author: JFrog

inputs.name: artifactoryService
inputs.label: Artifactory service
inputs.helpMarkDown: Artifactory service used for uploading artifacts.

inputs.name: specSource
inputs.label: File spec source
inputs.helpMarkDown: To specify the artifacts you wish to upload to Artifactory, please create a File Spec. To read more about the File Spec schema click here.

inputs.name: fileSpec
inputs.label: Spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use file spec from task configuration.

inputs.name: file
inputs.label: File path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use file spec from a local file.

inputs.name: replaceSpecVars
inputs.label: Replace spec variables
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select to replace variables in your File Spec.
In the File Spec, the variables should be used as follows: ${key1}.

inputs.name: specVars
inputs.label: Spec vars
inputs.helpMarkDown:
List of Spec vars.
List of variables in the form of "key1=value1;key2=value2;..." to be replaced in the File Spec.

inputs.name: collectBuildInfo
inputs.label: Collect build info
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select to collect build info and store it locally.
The build info can be later published to Artifactory using the "Artifactory Publish Build Info" task.

inputs.name: buildName
inputs.label: Build name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build name.
To use the default build name of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.DefinitionName)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'Artifactory Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build number.
To use the default build number of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.BuildNumber)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'Artifactory Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: module
inputs.label: Module name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Module name.
Optional module name for the build-info.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'Artifactory Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: includeEnvVars
inputs.label: Include environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to include environment variables in the published build info.

inputs.name: dryRun
inputs.label: Dry run
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select if you'd like the task only indicates which artifacts would have been uploaded
If not, the task is fully executed and uploads artifacts as specified

inputs.name: failNoOp
inputs.label: Fail task if no files were uploaded
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if you'd like the task to fail if no files were uploaded.

inputs.name: threads
inputs.label: # of threads
inputs.helpMarkDown: The number of parallel threads that should be used to upload where each thread uploads a single artifact at a time.

inputs.name: symlinks
inputs.label: Preserve soft links structure in Artifactory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if you'd like that Symlink file representation will contain the symbolic link and checksum properties.

inputs.name: setDebianProps
inputs.label: Set Debian properties
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select if you'd like to Specify the distribution/component/architecture of the package.
Used for Debian packages only.

inputs.name: syncDeletes
inputs.label: Sync and delete files from a path in Artifactory
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select if you'd like to set a specific path in Artifactory, under which to sync artifacts after the upload.
After the upload, this path will include only the artifacts uploaded during this upload operation. The other files under this path will be deleted.
